title: Official says affected Japanese firms should call police
description: Japanese businesses that were affected by anti-Japan protests in China should call police to seek help, the Ministry of Commerce said Wednesday.
cleanContent: By Mei Jingya, Sina EnglishJapanese businesses that were affected by anti-Japan protests in China should call police to seek help, the Ministry of Commerce said Wednesday.Shen Danyang, spokesman of the Ministry of Commerce, said Sept. 19 at a routine press briefing that China fully supports lawful and rational patriotic actions of Chinese people while pledging protection of Japanese interests in China.Shen made the remarks when a Japanese reporter asked him to comment on reports that some Japanese firms have halted productions amid assaults of violent Chinese protesters and whether China will consider compensations for Japanese business losses.“If foreign-funded enterprises are attacked by illegal bahaviors, they should call and report to the Chinese authorities, including police and business administration departments, to seek timely help,” Shen said.																																																																								|  |
